Package swingtree.api.mvvm

Interface Var<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the wrapped value.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Val<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractVariable
    public interface Var<T>
extends Val<T>
    A mutable wrapper for a value which can be observed by the Swing-Tree UI to dynamically update UI components for you, as well as trigger an action inside your view model.

    So for example if you have a Var which represents the username of a form, in your Swing-Tree UI you can register a callback which will update the UI accordingly or trigger a view model action.
    Consider the following example property in your view model: 

    
 	    // A username property with a validation action:
 		private final Var<String> username = Var.of("").withAction( v -> validateUser(v) );
    And the following Swing-Tree UI: 
    
 	    UI.textField()
 	    .peek( ta -> vm.getUsername().onShow( t -> ta.setText(t) ) )
 	    .onKeyReleased( e -> vm.getUsername().act( ta.getText() ) );
    Your view will automatically update the text field with the value of the property and inside your view model you can also update the value of the property to be shown in the UI: 
    
 	    // Initially empty username:
 		username.set( "" ).show();

    Please take a look at the living swing-tree documentation where you can browse a large collection of examples demonstrating how to use the API of this class.

      Var<T> act()
      Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using withAction(UIAction).

    • Method Detail

      • ofNullable

        static <T> Var<T> ofNullable​(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                             T value)
        Use this factory method to create a new Var instance whose value may or may not be null.

        Example: 

        
      Var.ofNullable(String.class, null);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the wrapped value.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the value wrapped by the property. This is used to check if the value is of the correct type.
        value - The initial value of the property. This may be null.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance.

      • of

        static <T> Var<T> of​(T iniValue)
        This factory method will expose a builder which will create a very simple type of Property, namely: AbstractVariable! It has a simple implementation for everything defined in the Var interface. So it can be touched, untouched, validated, initialized and applied. One may or may not use these features depending on the use case, however in most cases Var implementation are simple view properties which will need these functionalities.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value held by the Var!
        Parameters:
        iniValue - The initial value set to the instance built by this builder. Note: An initialization will overwrite this.
        Returns:
        The builder for a AbstractVariable.

      • of

        static Var<Viewable> of​(Viewable iniValue)
        Description copied from interface: Val
        This factory method will expose a builder which will create a very simple type of Property, namely: AbstractVariable! It has a simple implementation for everything defined in the Var interface. It is similar to an Optional with the additional feature of being mutable as well as being able to be observed for changes.
        Parameters:
        iniValue - The initial value set to the instance built by this builder. Note: An initialization will overwrite this.
        Returns:
        The builder for a AbstractVariable.

      • set

        Var<T> set​(T newValue)
        This method provides the ability to change the state of the wrapper. It might have several side effects depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • withID

        Var<T> withID​(java.lang.String id)
        Use this method to create a new property with an id. This id is used to identify the property in the UI or as a key in a map, which is useful when converting your view model to a JSON object, or similar formats.
        Specified by:
        withID in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the property.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance with the given id.

      • withAction

        Var<T> withAction​(UIAction<ValDelegate<T>> action)
        Use this method to create a new property with an action which is supposed to be triggered when the UI changes the value of this property through the Var::act(T) method, or simply when it is explicitly triggered by the Var::act(T) method.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be triggered when Var::act() or Var::act(T) is called.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance which is identical to this one, except that it has the given action.

      • act

        Var<T> act()
        Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using withAction(UIAction). This method is intended to be used in the UI to indicate that the user has changed the value of the property not your view model.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • act

        Var<T> act​(T newValue)
        Updates the state of this property and then, if the state has changed, trigger its action using the act() method.
        This method is intended to be used in the UI. If you want to modify the state of the property from the view model, as part of your business logic, you should use the Var::set(T) method instead.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • map

        default <V> Var<V> map​(java.util.function.Function<T,​V> mapper)
        Essentially the same as Optional.map(Function). but with a Val as return type.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Val<T>
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value returned from the mapping function
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function to apply to a value, if present
        Returns:
        the result of applying an Optional-bearing mapping
